title.narrative: Strengthening Nutrition and Feeding Practices at a Community Center in Tajikistan

description.narrative: SPOON’s comprehensive nutrition and feeding assessment revealed that 78% of the children ≤5 years of age had one or more nutrition-related problems, including stunting, wasting, underweight, and/or anemia. In addition, SPOON identified several areas of improvement in feeding techniques for CWD unable to self-feed independently. Following the assessment, SPOON trained Kishti staff on nutrition and feeding considerations for CWD, proper anthropometric measurements and use of growth charts, and anemia screening.

This project aims to strengthen the nutrition and feeding practices of children with disabilities (CWD) receiving services at a community-based center.
In collaboration with the Tajik Ministry of Health (MoH) and Health Prom (a UK-based organization working to ensure vulnerable young children have the best start in life), SPOON provided technical support to strengthen the nutrition and feeding practices at Dushanbe’s Kishti Center, a center that provides community-based services to families of vulnerable children. The Center extends its services to CWD living in institutions in the same community, providing a successful model of integration of institutionalized children into their local communities.
